headline: Man United transfer news LIVE - Sesko alternative, Isak 'enquiry', Sancho latest
body: Hello and welcome back to the Manchester United transfer blog on Thursday, July 31.

Those of you who decided to stay up overnight may well be feeling tired but shall be delighted with what you witnessed in Chicago. United continued their unbeaten start to pre-season with an exceptional 4-1 victory against AFC Bournemouth.

Rasmus Hojlund opened the scoring, before Patrick Dorgu, Amad and youngster Ethan Williams added gloss to the scoreline. The only blotch on the performance was an own goal from Matthijs de Ligt but it would do little to dampen the enthusiasm for that display.

Away from pre-season, United's main focus is now a move for RB Leipzig's Benjamin Sesko. The Reds are advancing their approach for the Slovenian after discovering that the pursuit of Ollie Watkins was unlikely to be fruitful.
The determination to sign Sesko has led to questions over Hojlund's future which Amorim addressed in Chicago overnight.
Take a look at all the United news, views and rumours in our dedicated blog below
Manchester United are little over two weeks away from their Premier League curtain raiser against Arsenal.
Ruben Amorim's side know there's plenty of work to do before then and it's been another busy day in terms of transfer news and speculation.
Here are your top stories this evening:
Man Utd club shop BANS fans from printing names of three legends on back of kits
Man United might have tricky path to sign £45m Benjamin Sesko transfer alternative
Stuttgart transfer chief makes Nick Woltemade stance clear amid Man United 'interest'
Man United transfer plan coming together amid Benjamin Sesko wait
Manchester United could be about to prove Alan Shearer right in the transfer window
Manchester United may be handed an opportunity to sign an alternative to Benjamin Sesko - if they miss out on a deal for the Slovenia international - according to latest reports.

Sesko has emerged as a primary striking target for United this summer as they look to add to their centre-forward options before the start of the new season. United have held a long-term interest in the 22-year-old, who rejected a switch to United in favour of RB Leipzig three years ago.

Manchester United could be set for a dream final month of the summer transfer window.

United badly needed to fix their goal-scoring issues after netting an abysmal 44 goals in the Premier League last term. Chances were regularly squandered by United's attacking players, who all lacked the composure needed to convert goal-scoring opportunities.

Those problems have been identified and seem to have been partly addressed with the signings of Bryan Mbeumo from Brentford and Wolves' Matheus Cunha. And yet a truly top squad needs a reliable goal-scoring No.9, and that's why they are chasing a deal for RB Leipzig forward Benjamin Sesko.
The 22-year-old has the attributes that Rasmus Hojlund has lacked to succeed in the Premier League. Sesko's pace, strength in the air and composure could make him one of Europe's finest strikers.

Attention should then turn towards a new midfielder with physical presence after Ruben Amorim's side were badly overrun in that department, for much of last season. Joao Palhinha would have fitted in well at Old Trafford, but the former Fulham player now looks set to join Tottenham Hotspur instead.

Stuttgart CEO Alexander Wehrle has reiterated the Bundesliga club will only sell rising star Nick Woltemade if they receive an "extraordinary" offer to bring them to the transfer table.

Bayern Munich had appeared to be the front-runners to sign the Germany U21 international, who shone during this summer's U21 European Championships. However, following Luis Diaz's move to Bayern, links with Woltemade have gone quiet.

The Sun has claimed that Manchester United and Newcastle are ready to do battle to sign the 23-year-old, who is valued in the region of £40million. Both clubs are currently battling to sign Benjamin Sesko from RB Leipzig as they prioritise a new striker ahead if the upcoming Premier League campaign.

Despite those fresh links, Wehrle has reiterated Stuttgart's stance on a departure for Woltemade this summer. He told Münchner Merkur/Tz: "I stand by what I said five weeks ago: We want to go into the next season with Nick - and if something extraordinary happens, we are ready to sit down at the table. Nothing has changed in that regard."

Understand Alexander #Isak has once again made it clear that he only wants to join Liverpool FC. Even Manchester United made an enquiry in recent days, but Isak turned it down. He only wants #LFC. The player’s camp remain optimistic that an agreement can be reached this transfer window, after a £120m bid was rejected by #NUFC. Isak’s agreement with LFC until 2031 is 100% done.

The United winger is expected to leave Old Trafford this summer and has been repeatedly linked with a move to the Serie A club, though no official approach has yet arrived.
Speaking to the Italian media, as realyed by Calciomercato.it, Comolli said:
I think the club is very attractive; many agents and players are calling me. After all, we are Juventus, and we want to get back to winning ways.

“Securing Conceição’s permanence was a clear and strong decision because he can play on both fronts. We have two of the best wingers in the world, and Nico is a great player. If someone were to leave, we will consider him [Sancho].”
RB Leipzig may have just dropped a hint over the future of Manchester United transfer target Benjamin Sesko.

United are in dire need of a reliable goalscoring striker after netting a meagre 44 goals in the Premier League last term - comfortably their lowest in a generation. Sesko and Aston Villa's Ollie Watkins have been the No.9's most heavily linked in recent times.

Amid speculation surrounding Sesko's future, his current club Leipzig have revealed their third kit for the forthcoming season - and the Slovenian striker is not seen in any of the pictures at the launch. The move is a possible indication that he may not be playing for them in 2025/26 - with the club unlikely to market the new kit with a player whose future remains uncertain.

With a month to go until the summer transfer window closes, Benjamin Sesko occupies top spot on Manchester United's striker wish list.

After missing out on Liam Delap and being linked with countless other strikers throughout the summer, there is a growing expectation Sesko might provide the answer United and head coach Ruben Amorim have been looking for.

Every summer during Erik ten Hag's two-and-a-half years in charge of Manchester United saw the club linked with a move for the Inter Milan full-back.
In the end, United signed Noussair Mazraoui for a bargain £12.8million fee last summer to provide competition to Diogo Dalot in the right-back ranks and their interest in Dumfries cooled.

The 25-year-old spent the 2024/25 campaign on loan at Premier League rivals Chelsea, but despite a £25million obligation to make the move permanent, the Blues chose to pay a £5m penalty fee to return him to Old Trafford.

United are keen to offload the winger this summer as they aim to bolster their attacking line-up. It is thought that the ex-Borussia Dortmund player doesn't feature in United boss Ruben Amorim's long-term plans and is likely to depart from M16 once more.

headline: Ruben Amorim has five undroppables in his strongest Man United starting XI
body: Whisper it quietly but Manchester United have looked quite good in their opening two games of their pre-season tour of the United States.
After a forgettable 0-0 draw against Leeds United in Stockholm a fortnight ago, the Reds have made significant strides since arriving in the US.
As a result, United will be hoping to clinch the Premier League Summer Series trophy with a maximum points haul when they face Everton at the Mercedes-Benz Stadium in Atlanta on Sunday night.
United made it two wins out of two with a comfortable 4-1 win over Bournemouth in midweek, getting the job done via goals from Rasmus Hojlund, Patrick Dorgu, Amad and substitute Ethan Williams.

United played with a sense of purpose, producing a really encouraging performance. Although pre-season caveats have to be accounted for, their performance was energetic, vibrant and really encouraging.

The tempo they set allowed them to move the ball with speed and a sense of conviction. One of the biggest criticisms they have faced in recent years has been for how uninspiring they have been to watch.

Clearly adapting and becoming more and more familiar with Ruben Amorim's system, United's improved collective performances have raised the levels of several individuals. Patrick Dorgu, who arrived from Lecce in February, was particularly impressive against the Cherries, contributing a goal and an assist.

With just two pre-season friendlies remaining, Amorim's team selections for the clashes with Everton and Fiorentina could provide a firm indication of the starting XI he has in mind for the season opener against Arsenal.

United have signed Diego Leon, Matheus Cunha and Bryan Mbeumo so far this summer and are still hoping to bring in a goalkeeper, a midfielder and a striker, meaning Amorim's dream starting XI is still a few signings short of coming to fruition.

Nevertheless, looking at the landscape of the squad as it is now, a crop of positions should be occupied by players the Portuguese chief already has available to him. Some positions have greater strength in depth than others, but that does not necessarily mean there isn't an obvious candidate to occupy top spot in the pecking order.
Leny Yoro has been excellent in United's opening two games in the US, playing an excellent range of passes and demonstrating his hunger and ability to get on the ball and drive United up the pitch.
The youngster is a shoo-in for the right-sided centre-back berth and will be one of the very first names on the teamsheet this season.

In the wing-back department, Amad and Dorgu were both on target against Bournemouth. The latter has been superb in the opening two games of the tour and was involved in both of United's first half goals against the Cherries.
Amorim wants his wing-backs to operate as wingers and occupy attacking positions. Dorgu did exactly that against Bournemouth and West Ham, pushing high up the pitch.

Amad started as the right-sided No.10 against Bournemouth, but his starting position could change depending on what Amorim considers as Mbeumo's best position. The Cameroonian could feature for the first time this weekend.

Bruno Fernandes was not on the scoresheet against Bournemouth, but his performance was just as influential. He regularly got on the ball in the centre of midfield and combined with Mason Mount and Amad in the No.10 berths.

The Portuguese international is United's best player by some distance and will be a shoo-in for however long he remains at Old Trafford, meaning he could afford to have a dire pre-season and still make the team for the first competitive game of the season. His influence and importance is unrivalled.

Fernandes linked up brilliantly with Cunha against West Ham and they will be hoping to develop a fruitful bond this season. The Brazilian has arrived from Wolves for £62.5million and has quickly demonstrated the sort of qualities he will bring to Old Trafford.
His running power, technical ability and creativity levels inside the final third make him a guaranteed starter. He is also a natural fit for the left-sided No.10 spot.
Mbeumo is yet to appear in pre-season so far, but the chances are he will join the list of undroppables once he's up to speed. The rest of the spots in the XI, however, are firmly up for grabs.

headline: Manchester United could get £30m boost to send Ruben Amorim warning to Premier League rivals
body: If Manchester United's fortunes are going to change during Ruben Amorim's first season in charge of the club, a big indicator will be the form of Patrick Dorgu in his first full campaign.
Amorim has been wedded to his 3-4-2-1 formation that brought him great success at Sporting CP but there have been teething issues when implementing it at Old Trafford.

United chiefs have full faith in the Portuguese's methods and the thinking is that while United suffered short term pain last season - their 15th place finish was their worst ever Premier League campaign - the long term benefit of players getting to grips with Amorim's methods will be worth it in the long run.
Amorim, of course, places huge importance on wing-backs and it was telling that his first signing in the January transfer window was Dorgu.
Manchester United have launched their new away kit for the 2025/26 season, inspired by the club's early-1990s Adidas snowflake kit.
United paid Italian side Lecce £30million to prise him from Serie A and despite United's struggles last term, there were some positive signs from the 20-year-old.
And the Dane has made a strong start to pre-season, too, scoring in the 4-1 win over Bournemouth on United's tour of the USA.
"I feel like the pre-season is helping everyone to understand Ruben's ideas even more," Dorgu told club media after that win over the Cherries.
"The more training we have, the more we will grow into his ideas and I feel like it is being seen a little bit on the pitch already. We just keep improving.
"Every game is a chance to improve and be ready for Arsenal. Every game is important and we will just take it game by game."
While pre-season is never the most reliable barometer to gauge a team's form, United have looked much better than they did last term.
The players look like they understand Amorim's ideas more clearly and the arrivals of Matheus Cunha and Bryan Mbeumo have given the whole club a lift.
Whether Dorgu succeeds or fails at United this season will reflect hugely on how Amorim is viewed, given he was his first signing and is so important to the success of his much maligned system.

The signs have been positive in the summer and Amorim will hope that continues into the Premier League later this month. If it does, with United not challenging on the European front next season, it could send a warning to their top flight rivals.

headline: Benjamin Sesko and more transfers Man United tipped to complete this summer
body: Ruben Amorim will be desperate for a better season this time around as Manchester United look to bounce back from one of their worst top-flight performances for over 50 years. The focus at Old Trafford has been on solid recruitment after their signings in recent years failed to live up to expectations.

The MEN has now examined the deals United could complete before the end of the transfer window, looking at the latest odds from bet365.
Benjamin Sesko
The MEN reported this week that United are advancing with a move for RB Leipzig star Benjamin Sesko.
United have been looking to sign an out-and-out striker throughout the summer and were handed the bitter pill of rejection when Liam Delap opted for a move to Chelsea.
Amorim's side and recruitment chiefs at Old Trafford have received encouragement over the pursuit of Sesko.

The market looks at which club the player will be at the beginning of September when the transfer window shuts and a stay at Leipzig is a long 12/1.

Manchester United writer George Smith says: Sesko is now at the top of United's wish list in their search for a striker, meaning he currently looks like the most likely candidate to come in and spearhead their attack.

Signing a 22-year-old, who has no experience of playing in the Premier League, will be considered as a huge risk by some fans - and that is understandable after the Rasmus Hojlund experiment - but the Slovenian's record is more polished than Hojlund's was at the time of him joining United in 2023.

Sesko has a high ceiling and could join an attack that has already been strengthened by the signings of Cunha and Mbeumo this summer. They will be able to assist with the goalscoring burden, easing the pressure on him.
Christopher Nkunku

The Chelsea striker has struggled to cement a starting place at Stamford Bridge, which has led to limited first-team opportunities for the Frenchman. His first season was plagued by injury and he was predominantly utilised off the bench during Enzo Maresca's debut campaign in 2024/25.
The MEN reported in June that Nkunku was not a prime target in United's pursuit of a centre forward, amid the Londoners' interest in Garnacho.
However, United have drifted in the market provided by Bet365 as they are now 10/1 shots for Nkunku's signature.
The odds provided by the bookmaker suggest a return to Germany looks most likely with Bayern Munich leading the chase, priced at 7/2 with a return to Leipzig 4/1.

Manchester United writer George Smith says: United need an out-and-out centre-forward before the window shuts and Nkunku isn't one. By his own admission, he is at his best when playing behind the striker.

United are well-stocked in the No.10 department, meaning they will not be eyeing anymore signings to fill that particular role this summer. Furthermore, the Chelsea attacker's record in the Premier League does little to inspire confidence; he has just six goals in 38 appearances.
Dominic Calvert-Lewin

Dominic Calvert-Lewin is currently a free agent after turning down a new contract at Everton. The forward has been previously linked with a move to Old Trafford during the height of his time at the Toffees.
The 28-year-old looked like a concrete option at Old Trafford following United's failed pursuit of Viktor Gyokeres and Liam Delap.
However, with the pursuit of Sesko seemingly moving in the right direction, Bet365 have taken and broadened United's odds in the chase to 5/1.
Newcastle and Aston Villa are the frontrunners at 2/1.

Manchester United writer George Smith says: Calvert-Lewin will be an attractive signing for a lot of clubs this summer, but he is not at the level United need him to be. He has played in the Premier League for nine seasons and has only reached double figures for goals twice - the last time being in 2020/21.

The former Sheffield United man scored just three goals in 27 league games last season, meaning he is not the reliable goalscorer United need. Even on a free transfer, United should be steering well clear.
Emi Martinez
Manchester United have had misfortune between the sticks in recent years with Andre Onana coming under fire for several high-profile mistakes.

United have been linked with a sensational move for Aston Villa shot-stopper and World Cup-winning goalkeeper Emi Martinez in recent months. The Argentine was heavily tipped to move to Saudi Arabia but those reports seem to have settled slightly, however Amorim's side continue to be linked with goalkeeping reinforcements despite priorities seemingly lying elsewhere.
Although, Bet365 consider an Aston Villa stay as his most likely destination after the transfer window closes, with their odds as short as 1/2 compared to United's 7/4.

Manchester United writer George Smith says: Like most goalkeepers, Martinez has a mistake in him, as highlighted when he clattered Hojlund on the final day of the Premier League season at Old Trafford in May.

However, he has been one of the best goalkeepers in the business over the last few years and would be an upgrade on Onana. Signing him, though, would be dependent on Villa's valuation and moving Onana on.
Gianluigi Donnarumma

Manchester United are reportedly interested in Paris Saint-Germain goalkeeper Gianluigi Donnarumma but Bet365 still consider the Champions League winners as leading contenders to retain the services of the shot-stopper.
The Italian is into the final 12 months of his contract in the French capital and Luis Enrique's side are said to be close to signing Lille goalkeeper Lucas Chevalier.
Bet365 have touted United as 3/1 contenders while Chelsea sit behind them at 7/1. A stay at PSG is a very short 8/15.

Manchester United writer George Smith says: The Italian is one of the best goalkeepers in the world and would be an excellent signing for United. He has been excellent for Paris Saint-Germain over the last few years.

Having kept seven clean sheets to help PSG win the Champions League last season, it is hard to imagine him being prepared to give up Champions League football for a campaign without any form of European football at Old Trafford.
Ollie Watkins
Ollie Watkins was an option for United as one of their targets for an out-and-out striker but, with Aston Villa adamant that he was not for sale, they were forced to look elsewhere.
The England Euro 2024 semi-final hero has been fiercely linked with a move away from Villa Park in the last 12 months, facing speculation over a move to Arsenal in January.

He is Premier League proven and would tie in with United's theme of raiding Wolves and Brentford for their star players already this summer.

Watkins, who scored 16 goals for Villa in the league last season, has scored 75 goals over the last five Premier League campaigns, reaching double figures on every occasion. His best season in front of goal was when he plundered 19 goals in 2023/24.
Although Villa are currently refusing to entertain the idea of selling him, United could do far worse than turning to him if their pursuit of Sesko fails.
Alejandro Garnacho
Chelsea are long-standing admirers of Manchester United winger Alejandro Garnacho and a report from The Telegraph claimed that the Londoners have no concerns over the character of their target.
The Argentine faces an uncertain future at Old Trafford after being one of five first-teamers to express a desire to leave Amorim's side.

However, he doesn't fit Amorim's wingerless system and his attitude has been called into question once too often. United are right to try and get him off the books.

headline: Manchester United could be about to prove Alan Shearer right in the transfer window
body: With a month to go until the summer transfer window closes, Benjamin Sesko occupies top spot on Manchester United's striker wish list.

After missing out on Liam Delap and being linked with countless other strikers throughout the summer, there is a growing expectation Sesko might provide the answer United and head coach Ruben Amorim have been looking for.

A cluster of big-name strikers have been on the move this summer, several of which had been linked with moves to Old Trafford, such as Viktor Gyokeres, Hugo Ekitike, Victor Osimhen and Delap. Sesko is one of the last big-name strikers available.

Although he is only 22 and still has plenty to prove, he boasts a respectable record for a striker of his age, scoring 90 career goals at club level in senior football. He joined RB Leipzig in the 2023 summer transfer window and has scored 39 goals in 87 games for the German outfit.

Described as a striker with "enormous potential" by United recruitment director Christopher Vivell, who previously worked at Leipzig, Sesko has been attracting attention for several years. United first expressed interest in him in the summer of 2022.

Despite only turning 22 at the end of May, Sesko has already established himself as Slovenia's chief striker. He has 16 goals in 41 caps for his country and started each of their four matches at the 2024 European Championship.

Although he was unable to get himself on the scoresheet in Germany, former Newcastle United and England striker Alan Shearer was encouraged by his performances at the tournament, backing him to end up in the Premier League sooner rather than later.
Speaking on The Rest is Football podcast, Shearer, in July last year, said: "He was feeding off scraps a lot of the time but I think he will be a really really good striker, I've no doubt about that.
"A lot of the big boys were after Sesko, weren't they? He's signed a new deal with Leipzig, but I don't think it will be long before we see him in the Premier League."
Also attracting interest from Newcastle United, Sesko has cemented himself at the top of United's wish list amid their desperate need for a reliable goalscorer.

United have finished each of the last two Premier League campaigns with a negative goal difference and know they can ill-afford to end the window without the addition of a new chief marksman. Rasmus Hojlund regressed last season and Joshua Zirkzee is not a striker.

Although Sesko is yet to step foot in the Premier League, his record and his potential has regularly seen him linked with clubs in England. If United secure his signature, only time will confirm if he can cut the mustard.

headline: Paul Pogba makes Marcus Rashford feelings clear with emotional message after Man United reunion
body: Former Manchester United midfielder Paul Pogba has shared a heartfelt message to his ex-teammates Marcus Rashford and Jesse Lingard following the pair's encounter this week. Lingard, 32, now plies his trade in South Korea with FC Seoul and, on Thursday, the La Liga champions ran-out 7-3 winners against them. Rashford was introduced at half-time, while his former United teammate played 81 minutes before he was replaced as Lamine Yamal made headlines with a brace.

The two ex-United stars were seen sharing time together after the full-time whistle and laughing together as they caught up. Lingard then posted a carousel of pictures on to his Instagram, including some with Rashford, Hansi Flick and Yamal with a fingers crossed emoji and a red heart emoji as the caption.
Pogba was then among those to show support in the comments, and took the opportunity to share a heartfelt message, which read: "Rasha x jlings I miss you my guys."
The 32-year-old Lingard has scored seven goals in 24 appearances, providing three assists in the K-League in his second season at the club.
Lingard has already eclipsed his goals tally from last season, equalling his assist total, following his transfer from Nottingham Forest after being released by the club.

Rashford's future, meanwhile, has been unclear for some time after falling out of favour under the club's now-former manager, before he failed to play his way into Ruben Amorim's plans, either.

headline: Jadon Sancho transfer latest - Manchester United exit 'talks' and £17.3m deal truth
body: Jadon Sancho is yet to resolve his future away from Manchester United as the winger continues to train at Carrington this summer.

The 25-year-old spent the 2024/25 campaign on loan at Premier League rivals Chelsea, but despite a £25million obligation to make the move permanent, the Blues chose to pay a £5m penalty fee to return him to Old Trafford.

United are keen to offload the winger this summer as they aim to bolster their attacking line-up. It is thought that the ex-Borussia Dortmund player doesn't feature in United boss Ruben Amorim's long-term plans and is likely to depart from M16 once more.
Italian clubs, including Juventus and Napoli, have been linked, as well as Turkish heavyweights Fenerbahce. Below is a round-up of all the latest on Sancho's future.

Sancho is one of four Reds players who are absent from United's pre-season tour of the United States. The Englishman, Antony, Alejandro Garnacho and Tyrell Malacia are all seeking moves away from Old Trafford this summer.
So far, United have only been able to offload Marcus Rashford, who was also part of the group. Barcelona signed him on a season-long loan with an option to buy.
Sky Germany reporter Florian Plettenberg has claimed that Dortmund are working on a deal to sign Sancho.
"Borussia Dortmund are still working on a transfer for Jadon #Sancho and are exploring the possibility of a third return," he wrote on X, formerly Twitter. "Talks are ongoing."
Dortmund sporting director, Sebastian Kehl, has admitted that the club are considering a move for Sancho.

"[Sancho] is constantly being linked with us," Kehl recently explained. "I understand the desire. We’re thinking about it within our possibilities. [If’ the conditions have to be right, we will definitely do something, but we’re limited."

Juventus general director Damien Comolli has seemingly dismissed the prospect of signing Sancho. Reports emerging from Italy in recent months have claimed that Juventus have been in a position to sign Sancho.
Tutto Juve relayed a report from La Stampa that United had agreed to sell the former Borussia Dortmund attacker for £17.3m, which is reportedly £4.3m less than the club's valuation.

The move, it was suggested, would see Sancho take a pay cut in order to make the move to Turin. However, the Italian side's general director has spoken to reporters and somewhat dismissed claims that they were closing in on the United outcast.
"We have two of the best wingers in the world in Yildiz and Conceicao, plus Nico [Gonzalez] who's an excellent player," Comolli said. "If anyone leaves, we'll be ready for the transfer market."

headline: Alexander Isak to Man United transfer truth explained as 'last-ditch move' considered
body: Amie is a football writer covering clubs across the country, she has been a football fan all of her life and supports Leicester City. She graduated with a degree in Sport and Exercise Psychology in 2015. Amie has previous experience in local radio in Leicester and Leicestershire.
Manchester United and their rivals have just one month of the transfer window remaining to make their move as the new Premier League season edges closer.
United have so far completed three signings, with Diego Leon joining Matheus Cunha and Bryan Mbeumo as new arrivals at Old Trafford this summer. The club are now working towards their next deal.
The main target has emerged as Red Bull Leipzig striker Benjamin Sesko, with the club looking to add a forward to their squad. United do, however, face competition from Newcastle United.

There continues to be a lot of talk about possible incomings in these last few days. With that in mind, here's a look at a couple of the latest stories, with our own thoughts reflecting what may or may not happen;
Manchester United have made an 'enquiry' over a possible transfer for Newcastle United striker Alexander Isak in recent days, according to Sky Germany's Florian Plettenberg.
The striker has been subject of a bid from Liverpool - totalling a reported £120million - but that was turned down by Newcastle. Liverpool are said to not be planning to go back with a second bid.
The report flags-up that Isak has reiterated his desire to join Liverpool, with an 'enquiry' from United turned down by the player.

Secondly, a lack of European football would again be a big factor. Champions League football is on offer at both Newcastle and Liverpool this season... So it's hard to see one of the best strikers in the world giving that up upon moving clubs this summer. As much as a move for Isak would be a stunning bit of business for United, it is a pipe dream for where the club currently are.

United could also make a late swoop for Middlesbrough midfielder Hayden Hackney - according to GiveMeSport. Championship club Ipswich Town have had a bid accepted for the player, but United could look to hijack the deal in a last-ditch move.
Hackney is said to have not rushed undergoing a medical with the Championship side after a £20million transfer was agreed, giving United hope of beating Ipswich to the deal.

United are said to have watched the played over a long period of time, but the club will have to give Hackney assurances over game-time if he choses to make a move to United. The club also face heavy competition from Tottenham and Everton.
He would provide support and competition to Manuel Ugarte in one of the deeper midfield roles alongside club captain Bruno Fernandes.

headline: Marcus Rashford gives perfect response to Man United reunion after Barcelona friendly
body: Marcus Rashford swapped shirts with a former Manchester United team-mate after Barcelona's pre-season friendly win over FC Seoul.

The 27-year-old made his second appearance for the La Liga champions at the Seoul World Cup Stadium in South Korea on Thursday afternoon as goals from Robert Lewandowski, Andreas Christensen, Ferran Torres, and Gavi secured a resounding 7-3 triumph for Hansi Flick's side.

However, there was an equally special moment for Rashford after the game as he was reunited with former United team-mate and close friend Jesse Lingard, who has played for FC Seoul since leaving the Premier League in 2023.

In footage captured by FC Seoul's social media accounts, Rashford and Lingard are seen laughing and joking in the tunnel after the game before the duo are joined by Barcelona's teen sensation Lamine Yamal.
Posting to Instagram after the game, Lingard revealed that he had swapped shirts with both Rashford and Yamal.
Clearly, Rashford enjoyed the reunion with Lingard as he reposted the story to his own Instagram account with emojis included.
He will be hoping to revitalise his career in Catalonia having fallen out of favour with Reds head coach Ruben Amorim.

"The situation with Manchester United is that the club is going through a period of change, and this has been ongoing for some time," Rashford said of his parent club. "I don’t have anything negative to say about Manchester United."

headline: Marcus Rashford sends Barcelona message after Man United reunion
body: Marcus Rashford has taken to Instagram after making his second appearance for Barcelona on Thursday afternoon.
The 26-year-old was a half-time substitute in the La Liga champions' 7-3 win over K-League outfit FC Seoul in South Korea.

headline: Isak ‘turns down’ Man Utd ‘enquiry’ as Newcastle rebel ‘remains optimistic’ of Liverpool ‘agreement’
body: Manchester United ‘made an enquiry in recent days’ for Liverpool-linked Newcastle United striker Alexander Isak, according to Florian Plettenberg.
Liverpool failed with their opening offer of £110million for Isak, and reportedly won’t return with an improved offer due to Newcastle’s swift and strong response.
The Magpies don’t want to sell the Swede, but it’s believed that a deal could be done for £150m.

Isak is doing all he can to secure a move to Anfield. He’s not training in the north east after being left behind for the club’s pre-season tour of Asia, and is currently using the facilities of his old club, Real Sociedad.
Despite his desire to leave and his recent behavior, Newcastle are willing to reintegrate the player and want him to sign a new contract.

Isak will not be swayed by another Premier League team, having made it clear Liverpool is his dream destination, with the Reds willing to spend over £100m on him despite recently adding Hugo Ekitike and Florian Wirtz for a combined £169m this summer.
Interestingly, it’s been reported that Man United made an enquiry this week, but were ‘turned down’.
This is according to Sky Germany journalist Florian Plettenberg, who says Isak remains optimistic that he will join Liverpool this summer, having agreed a six-year contract.
Plettenberg wrote on X: ‘Understand Alexander #Isak has once again made it clear that he only wants to join Liverpool FC.
‘Even Manchester United made an enquiry in recent days, but Isak turned it down. He only wants #LFC.
‘The player’s camp remain optimistic that an agreement can be reached this transfer window, after a £120m bid was rejected by #NUFC. Isak’s agreement with LFC until 2031 is 100% done.’

Ben Jacobs initially broke the news that Liverpool won’t make a second offer for Isak on Friday afternoon, and the transfer journalist has provided a few more updates since, explaining what could see the Reds return to the negotiating table.
Reporting on X, Jacobs explained the state of play:
– Liverpool say no second bid planned as it stands, as revealed.
– Bid was £110m fixed, with no add-ons.
– Personal terms with Isak not a problem.
– Liverpool bid with optimism this morning, but Newcastle’s response was so quick and strong another bid is not currently in the works.
– Key now is how Isak responds. Newcastle hoping he reintegrates and are prepared to offer him a new contract, likely with the ability to leave next summer.

– Should Isak double down, and continue to push for a move, and Newcastle find striker replacements, Liverpool could revisit their stance, but only if #NUFC contact them to offer encouragement. Liverpool won’t bid again unless Newcastle indicate they will discuss a sale.
Liverpool have ‘strung along’ Alexander Isak after ‘lowballing’ Newcastle United with a £110million offer on Friday, according to a report.
Liverpool are ‘pulling out’ of a deal to sign Alexander Isak, with BBC Sport revealing that their opening bid fell £40m below Newcastle’s valuation.
Liverpool will not bid again for Newcastle United striker Alexander Isak after their first offer was rejected, according to Ben Jacobs.
Liverpool are reportedly preparing to launch a second offensive to sign Alexander Isak from Newcastle United after their opening bid was rejected.
We can’t imagine Newcastle fans will be hugely encouraged by the thought of Darwin Nunez replacing Alexander Isak, but St James’ Park could be the perfect place for him.

headline: Man Utd ‘set to win’ Sesko chase with ‘internal confidence’ down to two key reasons
body: Manchester United are ‘confident’ they will beat Premier League rivals Newcastle United to the signing of RB Leipzig striker Benjamin Sesko, according to reports.

The Magpies and Red Devils are both incredibly interested in signing the Slovenian international, with Leipzig reportedly asking for £65million guaranteed, plus add-ons and a percentage of a future sale.
Newcastle quickly identified Sesko as their top choice to replace wantaway striker Alexander Isak, who is wanted by Premier League champions Liverpool.
United, meanwhile, want to recruit a new centre-forward after another difficult season for Rasmus Hojlund.
Ruben Amorim’s side have also been linked with Aston Villa’s Ollie Watkins, but appear to have picked the 22-year-old as their top striker target.
MORE: Five desperate Man Utd transfers to follow £69m Benjamin Sesko signing as Chelsea, Aston Villa profit
They might have been inadvertently boosted on Friday, with Newcastle turning down a £110m bid from Liverpool for Isak.
Liverpool are not expected to make a second bid for the 25-year-old Sweden striker, who did not travel to Asia for Newcastle’s pre-season tour.

It’s unlikely that the Geordies will sign Sesko if Isak isn’t sold, though Eddie Howe does want to sign another striker. Brentford’s Yoane Wissa is a target, but the Bees have told Newcastle he’ll cost at least £50m.
If Newcastle are no longer in the race to sign the Leipzig youngster, then United will have a free run at him and will become the strong favourites to win the race for his signature.

Even before it emerged that Liverpool won’t return with an improved offer for Isak, it was reported by United in Focus correspondent Graeme Bailey that there is an ‘internal confidence’ at Old Trafford that ‘they are set to win the chase for Sesko’.
Indeed, Bailey claims that Sir Jim Ratcliffe’s Red Devils are ‘very happy with how talks have gone in recent days’, though ‘they will not get ahead of themselves’.

Bailey told United in Focus: “During their talks Sesko confirmed that a lack of Champions League football this season was not a problem to him as the long-term project and the chance to work with Ruben Amorim were the major draws.

“I can also reveal that United made it clear to Sesko’s people that they are aware of the size of deal that would be required to land him and that they would not have entered into talks without that consideration.
“United are confident, there is no denying that but they are waiting – they also know that Newcastle have put forward a very strong case.”
Even without Champions League football, United are still able to lure the brightest of talents. Newcastle, meanwhile, are in disarray, but are willing to offer Isak a new contract.
As well as negotiating for Sesko, United are working on player sales, with Jadon Sancho, Alejandro Garnacho, Antony and Tyrell Malacia all available.
Man Utd boss Ruben Amorim is reportedly excited at the prospect of Benjamin Sesko joining with the Red Devils ‘very optimistic’ a deal will get done.
Man Utd have told RB Leipzig their ‘formal bid’ for Sesko is ready but Amorim is clashing with INEOS over the Red Devils’ striker plans this summer.
Man Utd will have no wriggle room once they cave and spend £69m on Benjamin Sesko, so they could easily finish this window with five desperate transfers…
According to reports, Manchester United’s ‘spending is to continue’ after landing Benjamin Sesko as they will turn their attention to a new top target.
Fabrizio Romano has offered Man Utd a huge boost in their bid to sign Benjamin Sesko as RB Leipzig “dream” of a swap deal for a ‘damned’ Red Devils star.
Romano has explained why he thinks players are “scared” to sign for Newcastle as top target Benjamin Sesko makes his ‘final transfer decision’.

headline: Arsenal, Man City leapfrog Real Madrid in biggest spenders in 2025 summer transfer window
body: Chelsea are bidding to be the world’s biggest spenders in the summer window for the fourth consecutive season, but Liverpool and maybe even Arsenal want a word.
All fees and figures are taken from Transfermarkt. The 20 biggest deals of the summer are here.

10) Juventus – £102.54m
After sneaking into the Champions League, there was money to spend. Jonathan David on a free transfer might be the coup of the summer but the biggest money has been spent on Francisco Conceicao from Porto.

9) Tottenham – £120.52m
Spent a decent whack of money spent on Kevin Danso, Mathys Tel, Luka Vuskovic and Kota Takai before Thomas Frank even got a say. Mohammed Kudus had shot Spurs up into the top three before they were overtaken again; Morgan Gibbs-White would send them scurrying back up the list if they can ever get that deal done.
CHECK OUT: The F365 transfer rumour power ranking

8) Sunderland – £122.53m
Eight first-team signings have come in. We’re not sure they’re finished, either.

7) Manchester United – £132.8m
The Red Devils were near the top of this list having signed Matheus Cunha for £62.5m and Diego Leon for £3.3m early doors but fell off it having taken a laughable amount of time to secure the £65m signing of Bryan Mbeumo.

6) Atletico Madrid – £135m
Alex Baena, Johnny Cardoso, Thiago Almada, Matteo Ruggeri and Marc Pubill have all cost a pretty penny and are aged between 22 and 24 as Diego Simeone rebuilds again. David Hancko completes the spending…for now.

5) Real Madrid – £144.4m
They had already dropped £50m on Dean Huijsen and £8.5m on a few weeks of Trent Alexander-Arnold before they agreed to sign man-child Franco Mastantuono for an awful lot of money. And then came Alvaro Carreras for another £43m.

4) Manchester City – £153.21m
That’s the price of a Rayan Ait-Nouri from Wolves, a Rayan Cherki from Lyon, a Tijanji Reijnders from AC Milan, a Sverre Nypan from Rosenborg, and a James Trafford from Burnley, and all of them feel like bargains.

3) Arsenal – £194.9m
The long-awaited and interminably drawn-out arrival of Viktor Gyokeres nudges Arsenal up towards a £200m summer but has plenty of final-piece-of-the-puzzle vibes as the Gunners leapfrog Real Madrid to make it a Premier League top three.

2) Chelsea – £210.6m
They were the top spenders in the summers of 2024, 2023 and 2022 and will be up there in 2025 thanks to pre-arranged moves for Estevao, Dario Essugo, Mamadou Sarr and Kendry Paez. Throw in the £30m signing of Liam Delap and the Blues were already making very expensive waves before they signed Joao Pedro for an initial £55m and Jamie Gittens for not much less.

1) Liverpool – £263.5m
Florian Wirtz has cost an initial £100m (yes, it could rise to £116m but we’re not worried about add-ons on this particular list) and now have the top two most expensive signings of the summer after confirming the arrival of Hugo Ekitike from Eintracht Frankfurt. Full-backs Jeremie Frimpong and Milos Kerkez have joined for £29.5m and £40m respectively, and we have also added the £25m on Giorgi Mamardashvili as that transfer will be counted in this summer’s accounts.

headline: Transfer rumour ranking: Isak to Liverpool in doubt as Spurs receive midfielder ‘Here we go’
body: Liverpool reportedly won’t bid again for Alexander Isak, given the nature of Newcastle’s rejection, which could help Man Utd land Benjamin Sesko.
With so much transfer talk doing the rounds, we’re here through the summer to sift through the bullsh*t and highlight the whispers that might have some substance.
Each day we’re ranking the top 20 rumours involving Premier League clubs, the higher the link, the more likely we feel they are to become done deals.
So we start with the tittle-tattle…

20) Darwin Nunez – Liverpool to Juventus
The Old Lady are the latest to throw their hat in the ring for Nunez, who was previously a target for Napoli. Liverpool have been keen to sell the Uruguayan striker for a while, but they are even more eager now that Alexander Isak is available. It doesn’t alter the fact that neither Juve nor Milan can afford what Liverpool are hoping to get.

19) 🆕 Lois Openda – RB Leipzig to Aston Villa
Villa are shopping around for strikers, which does hint at an exit for Ollie Watkins. Journalist Sacha Tavolieri says they are an ‘option’ for Leipzig No.9 Openda, who has scored 33 goals in 67 Bundesliga appearances.

18) 🔼 Marc Guehi – Crystal Palace to Liverpool
Football Insider’s Mick Brown is hearing things again, folks. Guehi to Liverpool could accelerate following Luis Diaz’s transfer to Bayern, apparently. The Crystal Palace captain’s “heart is set” on a move to Anfield, says the ex-Manchester United chief scout, who remains very well-connected within the game. FI’s words, not ours.

17) Leandro Trossard – Arsenal to Borussia Dortmund
The Gunners man is on Dortmund’s list of winger targets, with Jadon Sancho also under consideration. Arsenal could reinvest some of the money into Rodrygo, which means their supporters are bang up for this.

16) Gianluigi Donnarumma – PSG to Manchester United
Donnarumma has been in a contract dispute with PSG but we’re starting to think there might be more to this than his representatives using United’s name and the oldest trick in agent’s book. PSG are signing Lucas Chevalier from Lille and appear more likely to sell Donnarumma now than allow him to leave for nothing next year. United certainly need a goalkeeper, but they also need a striker and neither can be paid for with brass buttons. Still, one to watch…

15) 🆕 Samu Aghehowa – Porto to Aston Villa
The Spain international has also been linked with Newcastle but it’s Villa being mentioned as a potential destination for Aghehowa. One problem: Porto are using the Viktor Gyokeres fee as a benchmark and they want £55million. Which is more a less one whole Ollie Watkins.

14) 🔼 Alejandro Garnacho – Manchester United to Aston Villa 
United are said to have spoken to Chelsea and Villa in an effort to lump Garnacho in as part of a deal to sign a striker. Chelsea’s valuations of Garnacho and Nicolas Jackson are miles apart, but there could be some common ground with Villa. For the purposes of PSR, they would need to be separate transactions, but Villa are in a stronger position than United given they know Garnacho has got to go somewhere before the deadline, whereas they would be quite content to keep Watkins. Regardless, there is a deal to be done here.

13) Dominic Calvert-Lewin – Everton to Aston Villa
Calvert-Lewin left Everton at the end of last season and Villa reportedly see the ex-England striker as a cheap way to bolster their attacking options. Newcastle and AC Milan are thinking along similar lines but Villa currently appear to be favourites.

12) 🔽 Ollie Watkins – Aston Villa to Manchester United
This one picked up again after reports that United are to choose between Watkins and Benjamin Sesko. Of course, we’d expect Villa might want a say in that. And, if asked, they’d say they want £60million. United, apparently, reckon they can get Villa down to around £45million. But they thought they could haggle with Brentford and ended up paying more for Bryan Mbeumo. Watkins might find himself as United’s preferred option just because they could offer Garnacho to Villa.

11) 🔽 Benjamin Sesko – RB Leipzig to Newcastle
If Newcastle get a massive fee for Isak, you can bet any discount Leipzig were offering on Sesko will be voided. Let’s say the Toon get £120million for Isak and they spend £75million on Sesko and cover the Anthony Elanga fee. Is that so terrible? Regardless, Newcastle’s interest in Sesko goes back a year and some reports suggest personal terms are already sorted. But Man Utd’s interest complicates matters. The worst-case summer scenario for Newcastle could become a grim reality.

10) James McAtee – Manchester City to Nottingham Forest 
Forest are said to have had a bid rejected for the England Under-21 star, whose minutes at City are threatened by Rayan Cherki’s arrival. McAtee has interest from Eintracht Frankfurt and Borussia Dortmund, while Palace are keen too. But Forest aren’t far off with their £25million bid. We suspect this will come down to the player’s preference: stay in the Premier League, or a gap season or two in Europe?

9) 🔼 Yoane Wissa – Brentford to Newcastle
Newcastle are having a ‘mare of a summer, but some rare good news came in the form of Wissa’s desire to move to St James’ Park. However, and quite reasonably, we’ll add, Brentford are intent on keeping the forward having already lost their manager, captain and best player this summer. If Newcastle really want Wissa, they’ll have to pay over £40m for a player who was reportedly told last summer that he could leave for £26m at the end of 2024/25, prompting him to go on strike. With Brentford due back in London from their pre-season camp, we can expect some clarity here soon. The Bees have shown they are no pushover but Wissa isn’t f***ing around either.

8) 🔽 Alexander Isak – Newcastle to Liverpool
Liverpool’s first bid for Isak was made on Friday and very swiftly rejected by Newcastle. It was so emphatically rejected, in fact, that the champions reportedly won’t make a second bid. That leaves Isak in a very sticky situation, having burned plenty of bridges in the north east. The deal is dropping down our power ranking, but we’re refusing to rule it out completely…

7) Jadon Sancho – Manchester United to Juventus
It was reported ages ago that agreements had been reached between the clubs and the player, but still we wait. The reason, we suspect, is Juve stalling for time. They do need to sell, but they also know there is no other market for Sancho, If they sit tight, United will grow more desperate, as might the player, and better terms will almost certainly become available. Indeed, United’s price has come down again to between £15million and £17million (so, £16million?) and Sancho’s agent was in Turin last week in a vain attempt to speed things along.

6) Eberechi Eze – Crystal Palace to Arsenal
Viktor Gyokeres is signed, sealed and delivered and the feeling during that saga was that Eze would be the Gunners’ next target. The England star has, apparently, been telling his mates he’s moving to the Emirates, but Arsenal now need to deliver on Palace’s clear demand for his £68million buy-out clause to be met. Cue Andrea Berta haggling for weeks over the number of instalments. And the Gunners need to sell first.

5) 🔼 Benjamin Sesko – RB Leipzig to Manchester United
On Wednesday morning, we were told that Watkins was the priority; by Wednesday evening, it’s Sesko. As always, it seems United are fighting themselves, with some lobbying for Watkins, while head of recruitment Christopher Vivell is pushing for the player he’s credited with signing for RB Leipzig six years ago. Has anyone asked Ruben Amorim? Either way, players are “scared” to join Newcastle and not a team that just finished 15th in the Premier League. United’s boost is Newcastle’s blow. And Newcastle’s boost is still United’s boost. If Isak is staying at St James’, they should get a free run at Sesko…

4) 🔼 Xavi Simons – RB Leipzig to Chelsea
A Chelsea move appeals to Simons and the Blues are keen to make it happen. But first they need to raise some cash and even then, they will look for a hefty discount on the £56million RB Leipzig are demanding for the Arsenal target.

3)  Jorrel Hato – Ajax to Chelsea
This one is edging towards completion, with personal terms and a fee agreed. Liverpool and Arsenal were both keen, and Real Madrid were also linked, but Chelsea have been more decisive than any of them.

2) Joao Palhinha – Bayern Munich to Tottenham
Spurs got the ‘Here we go’ on Thursday night and has completed his medical. It’s a loan for Palhinha, with an option to buy for 30 million euros.

1) Aaron Ramsdale – Southampton to Newcastle
Newcastle faffed about all summer before eventually being elbowed out of the James Trafford race by Manchester City. So having missed out on one England keeper to replace their England keeper, they want a different England keeper, Ramsdale is having a medical on Thursday before the Toon pay £4million to borrow him for the season with the option of a more permanent arrangement.

headline: Man Utd ‘consider last-minute hijack’ of £20m Championship transfer as star ‘refuses to rush medical’
body: Man Utd could make a last-minute attempt to hijack Ipswich Town’s move to sign Middlesbrough midfielder Hayden Hackney, according to reports.

The Red Devils have have already made three signings this summer with Mathueus Cunha and Bryan Mbeumo arriving from Premier League clubs Wolves and Brentford respectively, while Paraguayan youngster Diego Leon has joined from Cerro Porteno.
Widespread reports indicate that Man Utd are looking to sign three more players before the end of the transfer window with Ruben Amorim wanting a striker, a midfielder and a goalkeeper.

Man Utd look to have settled on RB Leipzig’s Benjamin Sesko as their top centre-forward target, while there have been rumours that Paris Saint-Germain’s Gianluigi Donnarumma could be an option to improve their goalkeeping position.
The Red Devils have also been linked with a number of midfielders this summer with Valencia defensive midfielder Javi Guerra looking like a top option last month.

Man Utd are looking for a cheap option in midfield as a deal for Sesko could be worth upwards of £70m and now GiveMeSport claim that the Red Devils are ‘weighing up whether to make a last-minute attempt to win the race for the signature of’ Middlesbrough’s Hackney.

With Hackney looking for a transfer to the Premier League, GiveMeSport adds that Man Utd ‘recruitment chiefs have continued showing interest despite Ipswich Town having a bid accepted’.

Man Utd are ‘considering a last-ditch move to hijack’ and Red Devils boss Amorim ‘has been given hope of being able to lure him to Old Trafford as he has refused to rush into undergoing a medical at Portman Road’.

The England Under-21 international is ‘determined to be more than a squad player’ at his next club and Man Utd head coach Amorim ‘will have to give Hackney assurances over the amount of game time he can expect’.

Brown told WhichBookie: “Part of me feels that United should’ve gone for an out-and-out number nine but when the opportunity to sign players as good as Bryan Mbeumo and Matheus Cunha pops up, you don’t say no to them.

“They’re very good individuals who can get on the ball, run at players and make things happen. Mbeumo has been in mine and everybody else’s fantasy teams for the past few years because of his amazing output and I feel he’s probably been a bit underestimated.

“When Ivan Toney was at Brentford people were always talking about him being their best player, but looking back a lot of that good work was also down to Mbeumo. We’ve not seen him in a United shirt yet but I think he’s someone who will really surprise people.

“Regardless of what positions people think United need to strengthen in, I think these are the kind of signings they need to be making. Not only are they good players but they’ve already proven themselves in the Premier League and they’ve lacked that in recent years.”

headline: La Liga star rejects Man Utd as Arsenal ‘distance’ themselves from deal to focus on two PL stars
body: Man Utd have been rejected by Real Madrid winger Rodrygo, while Arsenal have decided to ‘distance’ themselves from a deal, according to reports.
The Brazilian has been in demand this summer with multiple Premier League clubs linked with a potential move for the Real Madrid star this summer.
Tottenham were the latest club to be linked with Man Utd and Arsenal among the clubs who have been mooted as soon as it was clear that Rodrygo could be available this summer.
The Brazil international has fallen down the pecking order at Real Madrid in recent times and there are rumours that he may not be a starter under Xabi Alonso this season.
Despite Man Utd being unlikely to afford a deal for Rodrygo, Spanish website Mundo Deportivo has claimed that the Red Devils have ‘shown interest’ in the player.

However, he ‘doesn’t want to go’ to Man Utd as Old Trafford is ‘not a destination that appeals to the player’ with the report insisting that London duo Arsenal and Tottenham ‘are the two best-placed clubs’.

But Spanish newspaper AS claims that Arsenal are ready ‘to forget’ Rodrygo, who is valued at €100m, ‘as they continue to work on signing a left winger’.

Potential moves for Crystal Palace’s Eberechi Eze and Newcastle’s Anthony Gordon are ‘gaining traction’ and their interest in the Premier League duo ‘further distances Rodrygo from the Emirates Stadium’.

Arsenal continue ‘to comb the market for one last reinforcement to complete a scandalous squad’ and now Eze ‘has the advantage over’ Rodrygo as Gunners boss Mikel Arteta and sporting director Andrea Berta look for a left-sided attacker.
Transfer expert Fabrizio Romano brought an update on Arsenal’s interest in Eze on Friday with negotiations between the Gunners and Crystal Palace yet to start.

“They spoke to the player several times and the player is also very keen on a move. So Palace expect Arsenal to arrive.

“Let’s see when let’s see how this conversation will go. Let’s so let’s see financially what they can do. But now the clause has 24 hours. Then the story is going to be over in the next hours basically for in terms of the release clause. It’s going to be over for the clause not for Arsenal, because Arsenal remain absolutely interested in the player.”
